message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about how rivers shape rocks over time. The pebbles of the Snake River are of non-rough edges because of the movement of the river. As the river flows, it constantly erodes and polishes the rocks, smoothing their edges. Option (A) is incorrect because "smoothness" is not the cause of the non-rough edges, but rather the result. Option (B) is unrelated to the formation of the pebbles. Option (D) suggests that rough rocks would lead to non-rough edges, which is logically incorrect.

This question requires knowledge about erosion and the effects of water movement on rocks. The reason the below surface pebbles of the Snake River have non-rough edges is due to the movement of the river. The constant flow of water causes friction and abrasion against the rocks, smoothing out their edges over time. Option (A) is incorrect because smoothness is the result, not the cause, of the river movement. Option (B) is incorrect because fish movement would not have a significant impact on the shape of the pebbles. Option (D) is also incorrect because rough rocks would not cause the edges of pebbles to become smooth.
